summary:
I am an architect and computational designer, interested in the combination of technology, art, and utilitarity. 
At the moment I perform as a computational designer at External Reference Architects, working in the field of algorithmic design, digital fabrication, and 3d-modeling. My main competences and responsibilities include complex geometry rationalization, digital fabrication and multi-objective optimizations. 

I have experience of work in international and interdisciplinary teams, for both academic research and professional projects. I am also passionate about new fields and ideas, therefore I participated in a broad variety of architectural projects and competitions. 

I constantly work on the improvement of my capabilities and knowledge and never hesitate to learn something new. Here is the list of professional skills I have obtained so far:

- Rhinoceros
- Grasshopper
- Grasshopper C#
- AutoCAD
- Revit
- SketchUp
- Photoshop
- InDesign
- 3d-printing + CURA
- CNC + RhinoCAM
- Model-making

I am also constantly improving my communication skills and, being a native Russian speaker, am also fluent in English and progress in Spanish.

Please, reach out to me if you are interested in parametric architecture & design, or would like me to work on your projects. I will be happy and interested to offer my skills, ideas, and performance.

treasury_media.description: A collection of my academic and professional works, developed by myself and in teams. This portfolio covers different typologies and scales of the projects I worked on and demonstrates my work, related to architecture, computational design and digital fabrication.

projects.title: Cosmic Congregations
projects.description:
In the recent years, humanity has had an increasing interest towards Outer Space and the new frontiers it brings. The limitless cosmos will serve as an endless source of inspiration. While the new generation of space-shuttles is being prepared to explore space, we decided to start speculating about the other-world architecture.

"Cosmic Congregations" is a computationally-driven architectural project, exploring the potential of subdivision loop operations for design of complex shapes. It was developed as a part of Python scripting seminar during the Masters in Advanced Architecture (2019-20) at Institute for Advanced Architecture of Catalonia.

The developed code allows to create almost endless number of iterations, by altering parameters such as attractor curves, subdivision aspect, offset depth and displacement. These intricate forms developed have been imagined as the new functional aesthetic for extra-terrestrial cohabitation.

contributors.headline: MAA Architect / Computational designer at External Reference
Architect on a mission to replace plastic foam with mushroom based material

projects.title: InGeo
projects.description:
This project is dedicated to designing and fabricating architectural system absorbing CO2 from the ambient air, that can either be installed on existing buildings as a second facade, or serve as a new-built infrastructure. We tested material properties and developed computational tools to optimize system performance. 
The project was developed in IAAC as a Digital Matter studio course project, together with Olivia Alvarez and Anton Koshelev. The project was tutored by Areti Markoupolou.

contributors.headline: MAA Architect / Computational designer at External Reference

projects.title: Reincarnation Network
projects.description:
"Reincarnation Network" is a winning proposal for RESIDE 2018 competition, organized by ArchOutLoud. In this project we worked on refurbishment and development of Worli Koliwada neighborhood of Mumbai, India. 
Our concept was build around the process of "reincarnation", when the typologies, colours, materials and logic of traditional indian architecture is recreated using contemporary technologies, materials and strategies, creating a more qualitative living environment, at the same time preserving the local spirit and atmosphere. 
We considered demands of the local community and analyzed future benefits, while developing our strategy, organizing new centers of interest and residential development in the neighborhood. 
The entire project is divided into 3 main parts: the urban zone, the cultural/touristic zone and the fishermen village. Each part has unique functions and centers of attraction, but all of them are united  by common style, concept and physical connections, such as pedestrian routes and aeration corridors. 
The pre-installed 3d structural grid can be filled by different residential modules, according to the demands of local citizens, and flexible layout enables potential growth and development of the area with time.
Several dozens of residential typologies and floor layouts were developed by our team, in order to fulfil all the personal preferences any dweller of Worli Koliwada could have. 
The coastline is elevated and reinforced to protect the area during the monsoon season. 
This project was also awarded the 3rd prize of Tamayouz 2018.

contributors.headline: Assoc. AIA / Architectural Designer at Paul A. Castrucci, Architects

profile_positions.company: Institute for Advanced Architecture of Catalonia
profile_positions.description:
As a student Computational Design Assistant at IAAC I am responsible for providing computational support to the students and assisting them with their projects. 

In addition to providing general computational design support, I have also performed as an assistant for two workshops, related to computational design and digital fabrication:

Complex Forming workshop (February - March 2020) 
This workshop was investigating potentials of computational design and digital fabrication for complex geometries design and production. 
I was responsible for leading a team of students, aiming to develop a material-informed lightweight structure and assemble a scaled model. 
The main tasks the team was working on during the workshop included the generation of compex geometry design, material optimization, the optimal assembly sequence and the sufficient structural performance of the final design. 

Bifurcation studio (April-May 2020)
At this desgn studio the students weredeveloping branching column systems and applying these structures for given architectural proposals. As an assistant I was mainly responsible for development of Grasshopper codes and giving advice and feedback on the general work on the design.
profile_positions.title: Computational Design Assistant

profile_positions.description:
While working in SVESMI I performed as an architect assistant in development of such projects as "The House of Text" (Extension of State Pushkin Museum of Fine Arts) in Moscow, Russia, and "European Shore" building in Novosibirsk, Russia. 

Throughout "The House of Text" project I was mainly responsible for implementation of technical drawings, 3d-modeling and assisting in the interior design development. At the latter stages of the project I was preparing presentations and attended meetings with clients.

I was also assisting in 3d-modeling and facade development for "The European Shore" residential building. At present, the building is already constructed.
profile_positions.title: Architectural Intern

profile_positions.description: In NAI Becar I was working on development of several Public projects, such as development of transportation hubs in Moscow. I also developed conceptual 3d-model of an apart-hotel in Moscow. During my career in NAI Becar I was mainly responsible for technical drawings, 3d-modeling and masterplan conceptual development. After three months of work I was promoted from an Intern to Junior Architect position, and after that was also attending meetings with Governmental and Private clients.
profile_positions.title: Architectural Assistant
